00047 void SVM::setTrainingData(const Array<double>& input, const Array<double>& target)
00048 {
00049         x = &input;
00050         y = &target;
00051         bOwnMemory = false;
00052 
00053         examples = input.dim(0);
00054         dimension = input.dim(1);
00055         SIZE_CHECK(target.dim(0) == examples);
00056 
00057         parameter.resize(examples + 1);
00058         parameter = 0.0;
00059 }

00061 void SVM::model(const Array<double>& input, Array<double>& output)
00062 {
00063         const double* xx;
00064         const double* ii;
00065         unsigned int i;
00066         double a;
00067         double alpha;
00068         if (input.ndim() == 1)
00069         {
00070                 output.resize(1, false);
00071                 a = parameter(examples);
00072                 xx = x->elemvec();
00073                 ii = input.elemvec();
00074                 for (i=0; i<examples; i++)
00075                 {
00076                         alpha = parameter(i);
00077                         if (alpha > 0.0)
00078                         {
00079                                 a += alpha * (*y)(i) * kernel->eval(xx, ii, dimension);
00080                         }
00081                         xx += dimension;
00082                 }
00083                 output(0) = a;
00084         }
00085         else if (input.ndim() == 2)
00086         {
00087                 int j, jc = input.dim(0);
00088                 output.resize(jc, false);
00089                 for (j=0; j<jc; j++)
00090                 {
00091                         a = parameter(examples);
00092                         xx = x->elemvec();
00093                         ii = input[j].elemvec();
00094                         for (i=0; i<examples; i++)
00095                         {
00096                                 alpha = parameter(i);
00097                                 if (alpha > 0.0)
00098                                 {
00099                                         a += alpha * (*y)(i) * kernel->eval(xx, ii, dimension);
00100                                 }
00101                                 xx += dimension;
00102                         }
00103                         output(j) = a;
00104                 }
00105         }
00106         else throw "[SVM::model] invalid dimension";
00107 }

00109 void SVM::modelDerivative(const Array<double>& input, Array<double>& derivative)
00110 {
00111         const double* xx;
00112         const double* ii;
00113         unsigned int i;
00114         double v;
00115         if (input.ndim() == 1)
00116         {
00117                 derivative.resize(1, examples + 1, false);
00118                 derivative = 0.0;
00119                 xx = x->elemvec();
00120                 ii = input.elemvec();
00121                 for (i=0; i<examples; i++)
00122                 {
00123                         v = (*y)(i) * kernel->eval(xx, ii, dimension);
00124                         xx += dimension;
00125                         derivative(0, i) = v;
00126                 }
00127                 derivative(0, examples) = 1.0;
00128         }
00129         else if (input.ndim() == 2)
00130         {
00131                 int j, jc = input.dim(0);
00132                 derivative.resize(jc, examples + 1, false);
00133                 derivative = 0.0;
00134                 for (j=0; j<jc; j++)
00135                 {
00136                         xx = x->elemvec();

00141                                 xx += dimension;
00142                                 derivative(j, i) = v;
00143                         }
00144                         derivative(j, examples) = 1.0;
00145                 }
00146         }
00147         else throw "[SVM::modelDerivative] invalid dimension";

00150 void SVM::modelDerivative(const Array<double>& input, Array<double>& output, Array<double>& derivative)
00151 {
00152         const double* xx;
00153         const double* ii;
00154         unsigned int i;
00155         double a, v;
00156         if (input.ndim() == 1)
00157         {
00158                 derivative.resize(1, examples + 1, false);
00159                 derivative = 0.0;
00160                 output.resize(1, false);
00161                 a = parameter(examples);
00162                 xx = x->elemvec();
00163                 ii = input.elemvec();
00164                 for (i=0; i<examples; i++)
00165                 {
00166                         v = (*y)(i) * kernel->eval(xx, ii, dimension);
00167                         xx += dimension;
00168                         a += parameter(i) * v;
00169                         derivative(0, i) = v;
00170                 }
00171                 output(0) = a;
00172                 derivative(0, examples) = 1.0;
00173         }
00174         else if (input.ndim() == 2)
00175         {
00176                 int j, jc = input.dim(0);
00177                 output.resize(jc, false);
00178                 derivative.resize(jc, examples + 1, false);
00179                 derivative = 0.0;
00180                 for (j=0; j<jc; j++)
00181                 {
00182                         a = parameter(examples);
00183                         xx = x->elemvec();
00184                         ii = input[j].elemvec();
00185                         for (i=0; i<examples; i++)
00186                         {
00187                                 v = (*y)(i) * kernel->eval(xx, ii, dimension);
00188                                 xx += dimension;
00189                                 a += parameter(i) * v;
00190                                 derivative(j, i) = v;
00191                         }
00192                         output(j) = a;
00193                         derivative(j, examples) = 1.0;
00194                 }
00195         }
00196         else throw "[SVM::modelDerivative] invalid dimension";
00197 }

00199 bool SVM::LoadSVMModel(std::istream& is)
00200 {
00201         char buffer[50];
00202         unsigned int t, d;
00203 
00204         // read the header line
00205         is.read(buffer, 21);
00206 
00207         buffer[21] = 0;
00208         if (strcmp(buffer, "Shark SVM model\r\nSV: ") != 0) return false;
00209         if (! is.good()) return false;
00210 
00211         // read the number of support vectors
00212         is >> examples;
00213 
00214         is.read(buffer, 7); buffer[7] = 0;
00215         if (strcmp(buffer, "\r\nDIM: ") != 0) return false;
00216         if (! is.good()) return false;
00217 
00218         // read the input space dimension
00219         is >> dimension;
00220 
00221         is.read(buffer, 10); buffer[10] = 0;
00222         if (strcmp(buffer, "\r\nkernel: ") != 0) return false;
00223         if (! is.good()) return false;
00224 
00225         // read the kernel parameters
00226         is >> (*kernel);
00227 
00228         is.read(buffer, 14); buffer[14] = 0;
00229         if (strcmp(buffer, "coefficients: ") != 0) return false;
00230         if (! is.good()) return false;
00231 
00232         // read alpha and b
00233         parameter.resize(examples + 1);
00234         for (t=0; t<examples; t++)
00235         {
00236                 is >> parameter(t);
00237                 is.read(buffer, 1);
00238                 if (buffer[0] != ' ') return false;
00239         }
00240         is >> parameter(examples);
00241         is.read(buffer, 2); buffer[2] = 0;
00242         if (strcmp(buffer, "\r\n") != 0) return false;
00243         if (! is.good()) return false;
00244 
00245         // read the support vectors with labels
00246         Array<double>* sv = new Array<double>(examples, dimension);
00247         Array<double>* l = new Array<double>(examples);
00248         for (t=0; t<examples; t++)
00249         {
00250                 for (d=0; d<dimension; d++)
00251                 {
00252                         is >> (*sv)(t, d);
00253                         is.read(buffer, 1);
00254                         if (buffer[0] != ' ') return false;
00255                 }
00256                 is >> (*l)(t);
00257                 is.read(buffer, 2); buffer[2] = 0;
00258                 if (strcmp(buffer, "\r\n") != 0) return false;
00259                 if (! is.good()) return false;
00260         }
00261 
00262         bOwnMemory = true;
00263         x = sv;
00264         y = l;
00265 
00266         return true;
00267 }
00268 
00269 bool SVM::SaveSVMModel(std::ostream& os)
00270 {
00271         unsigned int t, d;
00272         unsigned int T = 0;
00273         for (t=0; t<examples; t++) if (parameter(t) > 0.0) T++;
00274 
00275         // write the header line
00276         os.write("Shark SVM model\r\nSV: ", 21);
00277 
00278         // write the number of support vectors
00279         os << T;
00280 
00281         os.write("\r\nDIM: ", 7);
00282         if (! os.good()) return false;
00283 
00284         // write the input space dimension
00285         os << dimension;
00286 
00287         os.write("\r\nkernel: ", 10);
00288         if (! os.good()) return false;
00289 
00290         // write the kernel parameters
00291         os << (*kernel);
00292 
00293         os.write("coefficients: ", 14);
00294         if (! os.good()) return false;
00295 
00296         // write alpha and b
00297         for (t=0; t<examples; t++) if (parameter(t) > 0.0) os << parameter(t) << " ";
00298         os << parameter(examples) << "\r\n";
00299         if (! os.good()) return false;
00300 
00301         // write the support vectors with labels
00302         for (t=0; t<examples; t++)
00303         {
00304                 if (parameter(t) > 0.0)
00305                 {
00306                         for (d=0; d<dimension; d++)
00307                         {
00308                                 os << (*x)(t, d) << " ";
00309                         }
00310                         os << (*y)(t);
00311                         os.write("\r\n", 2);
00312                         if (! os.good()) return false;
00313                 }
00314         }
00315 
00316         return true;
00317 }

00323 C_SVM::C_SVM(SVM* pSVM, double Cplus, double Cminus, bool norm2, bool unconst)
00324 {
00325         svm = pSVM;
00326         C_plus = Cplus;
00327         C_minus = Cminus;
00328         C_ratio = Cminus / Cplus;
00329         norm2penalty = norm2;
00330         exponential = unconst;
00331 
00332         KernelFunction* kernel = svm->getKernel();
00333         unsigned int k, kc = kernel->getParameterDimension();
00334         parameter.resize(kc + 1, false);
00335         parameter(0) = (exponential) ? log(Cplus) : Cplus;
00336         for (k=0; k<kc; k++) parameter(k + 1) = kernel->getParameter(k);
00337 }

00340 {
00341 }

00343 void C_SVM::model(const Array<double>& input, Array<double> &output)
00344 {
00345         svm->model(input, output);
00346 }
00347 
00348 void C_SVM::setParameter(unsigned int index, double value)
00349 {
00350         Model::setParameter(index, value);
00351         if (index == 0)
00352         {
00353                 // set C_+ and C_-
00354                 if (exponential)
00355                 {
00356                         value = exp(value);
00357                 }
00358                 C_plus = value;
00359                 C_minus = C_ratio * value;
00360         }
00361         else
00362         {
00363                 // set a kernel parameter
00364                 svm->getKernel()->setParameter(index - 1, value);
00365         }
00366 }
00367 
00368 double C_SVM::get_Cplus()
00369 {
00370         return C_plus;
00371 }
00372 
00373 double C_SVM::get_Cminus()
00374 {
00375         return C_minus;
00376 }

00395 void SVM_Optimizer::init(Model& model)
00396 {
00397         C_SVM* pSVM = dynamic_cast<C_SVM*>(&model);
00398         if (pSVM == NULL)
00399                 throw "[SVM_Optimizer::init] The model is not a valid C_SVM.";
00400 
00401         Cplus = pSVM->get_Cplus();
00402         Cminus = pSVM->get_Cminus();
00403         norm2penalty = pSVM->is2norm();
00404 }
00405 
00406 void SVM_Optimizer::init(C_SVM& model, bool verbose, unsigned int mb)
00407 {
00408         init(model);
00409         printInfo = verbose;
00410         cacheMB = mb;
00411 }

00413 double SVM_Optimizer::optimize(Model& model, ErrorFunction& error, const Array<double>& input, const Array<double>& target)
00414 {
00415         SVM* pSVM = dynamic_cast<SVM*>(&model);
00416         if (pSVM == NULL)
00417         {
00418                 C_SVM* pC_SVM = dynamic_cast<C_SVM*>(&model);
00419                 if (pC_SVM != NULL) pSVM = pC_SVM->getSVM();
00420         }
00421 
00422         if (pSVM == NULL)
00423                 throw "[SVM_Optimizer::optimize] The model is not a valid SVM or C_SVM.";
00424 
00425         optimize(*pSVM, input, target);
00426 
00427         return 0.0;
00428 }
00429 
00430 void SVM_Optimizer::optimize(SVM& model, const Array<double>& input, const Array<double>& target)
00431 {
00432         if (solver != NULL) delete solver;
00433 
00434         model.setTrainingData(input, target);
00435 
00436         KernelFunction* kernel = model.getKernel();
00437         unsigned int i, examples = model.get_examples();
00438 
00439         Array<double> ones(examples);
00440         Array<double> C(examples);
00441         ones = 1.0;
00442         for (unsigned int e=0; e<examples; e++) C(e) = (target(e) > 0.0) ? Cplus : Cminus;
00443 
00444         Array<double> alpha(examples);
00445         for (i=0; i<examples; i++) alpha(i) = model.getParameter(i);
00446         double b = model.getParameter(examples);
00447 
00448         solver = new C_Solver(kernel, input, target, ones, target, C, alpha, b, printInfo, cacheMB, 0.001, "", true, norm2penalty);
00449 
00450         for (i=0; i<examples; i++) model.setParameter(i, alpha(i));
00451         model.setParameter(examples, b);
00452 }
